formatted_items.arguments:
{
  "to": ["mark@trustwellbank.com"],
  "subject": "Re: Inquiry about Bank Procedures",
  "body": "Hi Mark,

Thank you for reaching out. I’m glad to clarify the bank’s core procedures and point you to the right resources.

1. Verifying Customer Identity
   • Request two forms of ID (e.g., driver’s license plus account security question).
   • Confirm the customer’s account number and one recent transaction.

2. Handling Customer Inquiries
   • Log the interaction in the Customer Interaction Log within the core banking system.
   • Follow the product-specific SOP that applies (see the Procedures portal ➜ “Account Services” or “Loan Servicing”).
   • Communicate an estimated resolution time to the customer.

3. Reporting or Escalating Issues
   • If you cannot resolve the inquiry during the first contact, or if you detect a policy violation/system outage, escalate to our Help Desk:
     internal-help@trustwellbank.com  |  extension 7788.
   • For urgent or high-impact incidents (service interruption, suspected fraud), immediately call the on-duty Branch Manager. Phone numbers are in the “Regional Managers Contact List.”

Additional Resources
• Bank Procedures Overview (Notion link sent during orientation) – flowcharts of every step mentioned above.
• Regional Managers Contact List – direct numbers for each branch.
• Training Portal ➜ “Customer Care Playbook” – quick reference scripts and compliance checklists.

Please let me know if you need any of these documents resent or if you’d like to schedule a brief walk-through. I’m happy to help.

Best regards,
Jane
"
}

formatted_items.content: I’ve sent Mark a detailed response covering identity verification, handling inquiries, escalation paths, and links to supporting resources. Let me know if you’d like any adjustments or additional follow-up.
